paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the BRCA2 999del5 variant, its expression, and implications for cancer risk in heterozygous individuals.

patients.demographics: heterozygous individuals, specific demographics not detailed

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 999del5 variant leads to unstable mRNA and no detectable protein product, suggesting haploinsufficiency contributes to cancer risk.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with increased breast cancer risk in heterozygous individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the instability of the BRCA2 999del5 protein and its implications for cancer risk.
key_quotes: Our results show that the protein product of BRCA2 999del5 is extremely unstable.
An increase in breast cancer risk in BRCA2 999del5 carriers is due to haploinsufficiency at the BRCA2 locus.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in BRCA2.
